definitions.definition: A governor or ruler of a quarter of a country , especially of a fourth part of a province in or client state of Ancient Rome .
Each of the four members of a jointly ruling tetrarchy , notably of the Roman Empire since Diocletian.
An officer in charge of a fourth part of a phalanx in Ancient Greece .

main_definition: A governor or ruler of a quarter of a country , especially of a fourth part of a province in or client state of Ancient Rome .
secondary_definitions: Each of the four members of a jointly ruling tetrarchy , notably of the Roman Empire since Diocletian.
An officer in charge of a fourth part of a phalanx in Ancient Greece .
